Subject: Math
Code Description: RP

Subject: Math
Code Description: Understand the concept of a ratio and use ratio language to describe a ratio relationship between two quantities.

Subject: Math
Code Description: Understand the concept of a unit rate a/b associated with a ratio a:b with b ≠ 0, and use rate language in the context of a ratio relationship.

Subject: Math
Code Description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems, e.g., by reasoning about tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line diagrams, or equations.

Subject: Math
Code Description: NS

Subject: Math
Code Description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions, and solve word problems involving division of fractions by fractions, e.g., by using visual fraction models and equations to represent the problem.

Subject: Math
Code Description: Fluently divide multi-digit numbers using the standard algorithm.

Subject: Math
Code Description: Fluently add, subtract, multiply, and divide multi-digit decimals using the standard algorithm for each operation.

Subject: Math
Code Description: Find the greatest common factor of two whole numbers less than or equal to 100 and the least common multiple of two whole numbers less than or equal to 12. Use the distributive property to express a sum of two whole numbers 1–100 with a common factor as a multiple of a sum of two whole numbers with no common factor.

Subject: Math
Code Description: Understand that positive and negative numbers are used together to describe quantities having opposite directions or values (e.g., temperature above/below zero, elevation above/below sea level, credits/debits, positive/negative electric charge); use positive and negative numbers to represent quantities in real-world contexts, explaining the meaning of 0 in each situation.

Subject: Math
Code Description: Understand a rational number as a point on the number line. Extend number line diagrams and coordinate axes familiar from previous grades to represent points on the line and in the plane with negative number coordinates.

Subject: Math
Code Description: Understand ordering and absolute value of rational numbers.

Subject: Math
Code Description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems by graphing points in all four quadrants of the coordinate plane. Include use of coordinates and absolute value to find distances between points with the same first coordinate or the same second coordinate.

Subject: Math
Code Description: EE

Subject: Math
Code Description: Write and evaluate numerical expressions involving whole-number exponents.

Subject: Math
Code Description: Write, read, and evaluate expressions in which letters stand for numbers.

Subject: Math
Code Description: Apply the properties of operations to generate equivalent expressions.

Subject: Math
Code Description: Identify when two expressions are equivalent

Subject: Math
Code Description: Understand solving an equation or inequality as a process of answering a question: which values from a specified set, if any, make the equation or inequality true? Use substitution to determine whether a given number in a specified set makes an equation or inequality true.

Subject: Math
Code Description: Use variables to represent numbers and write expressions when solving a real-world or mathematical problem; understand that a variable can represent an unknown number, or, depending on the purpose at hand, any number in a specified set.

Subject: Math
Code Description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems by writing and solving equations of the form x + p = q and px = q for cases in which p, q and x are all nonnegative rational numbers.

Subject: Math
Code Description: Write an inequality of the form x > c or x < c to represent a constraint or condition in a real-world or mathematical problem. Recognize that inequalities of the form x > c or x < c have infinitely many solutions; represent solutions of such inequalities on number line diagrams.

Subject: Math
Code Description: Use variables to represent two quantities in a real-world problem that change in relationship to one another; write an equation to express one quantity, thought of as the dependent variable, in terms of the other quantity, thought of as the independent variable. Analyze the relationship between the dependent and independent variables using graphs and tables, and relate these to the equation. For example, in a problem involving motion at constant speed, list and graph ordered pairs of distances and times, and write the equation d = 65t to represent the relationship between distance and time.

Subject: Math
Code Description: G

Subject: Math
Code Description: Find the area of right triangles, other triangles, special quadrilaterals, and polygons by composing into rectangles or decomposing into triangles and other shapes; apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.

Subject: Math
Code Description: Find the volume of a right rectangular prism with fractional edge lengths by packing it with unit cubes of the appropriate unit fraction edge lengths, and show that the volume is the same as would be found by multiplying the edge lengths of the prism. Apply the formulas V = l w h and V = b h to find volumes of right rectangular prisms with fractional edge lengths in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.

Subject: Math
Code Description: Draw polygons in the coordinate plane given coordinates for the vertices; use coordinates to find the length of a side joining points with the same first coordinate or the same second coordinate. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.

Subject: Math
Code Description: Represent three-dimensional figures using nets made up of rectangles and triangles, and use the nets to find the surface area of these figures. Apply these techniques in the context of solving real-world and mathematical problems.

Subject: Math
Code Description: SP

Subject: Math
Code Description: Recognize a statistical question as one that anticipates variability in the data related to the question and accounts for it in the answers.

Subject: Math
Code Description: Understand that a set of data collected to answer a statistical question has a distribution which can be described by its center, spread, and overall shape.

Subject: Math
Code Description: Recognize that a measure of center for a numerical data set summarizes all of its values with a single number, while a measure of variation describes how its values vary with a single number.

Subject: Math
Code Description: Display numerical data in plots on a number line, including dot plots, histograms, and box plots.

Subject: Math
Code Description: Summarize numerical data sets in relation to their context

Subject: Science
Code Description: RST

Subject: Science
Code Description: Cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of science and technical texts.

Subject: Science
Code Description: Determine the central ideas or conclusions of a text; provide an accurate summary of the text distinct from prior knowledge or opinions.

Subject: Science
Code Description: Follow precisely a multistep procedure when carrying out experiments, taking measurements, or performing technical tasks.

Subject: Science
Code Description: Determine the meaning of symbols, key terms, and other domain-specific words and phrases as they are used in a specific scientific or technical context relevant to grades 6–8 texts and topics.

Subject: Science
Code Description: Analyze the structure an author uses to organize a text, including how the major sections contribute to the whole and to an understanding of the topic.

Subject: Science
Code Description: Analyze the author’s purpose in providing an explanation, describing a procedure, or discussing an experiment in a text.

Subject: Science
Code Description: Integrate quantitative or technical information expressed in words in a text with a version of that information expressed visually (e.g., in a flowchart, diagram, model, graph, or table).

Subject: Science
Code Description: Distinguish among facts, reasoned judgment based on research findings, and speculation in a text.

Subject: Science
Code Description: Compare and contrast the information gained from experiments, simulations, video, or multimedia sources with that gained from reading a text on the same topic.

Subject: Science
Code Description: By the end of grade 8, read and comprehend science/technical texts in the grades 6–8 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

Subject: Reading
Code: Speaking and Listening Comprehension and Collaboration
Code Description: SL

Subject: Reading
Code Description: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 6 topics, texts, and issues, building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly.

Subject: Reading
Code Description: Come to discussions prepared, having read or studied required material; explicitly draw on that preparation by referring to evidence on the topic, text, or issue to probe and reflect on ideas under discussion.

Subject: Reading
Code Description: Follow rules for collegial discussions, set specific goals and deadlines, and define individual roles as needed.

Subject: Reading
Code Description: Pose and respond to specific questions with elaboration and detail by making comments that contribute to the topic, text, or issue under discussion.

Subject: Reading
Code Description: Interpret information presented in diverse media and formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively, orally) and explain how it contributes to a topic, text, or issue under study.

Subject: Reading
Code Description: Delineate a speaker’s argument and specific claims, distinguishing claims that are supported by reasons and evidence from claims that are not.

Subject: Reading
Code Description: RL

Subject: Reading
Code Description: Cite textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

Subject: Reading
Code Description: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and how it is conveyed through particular details; provide a summary of the text distinct from personal opinions or judgments.

Subject: Reading
Code Description: Describe how a particular story’s or drama’s plot unfolds in a series of episodes as well as how the characters respond or change as the plot moves toward a resolution.

Subject: Reading
Code Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of a specific word choice on meaning and tone.

Subject: Reading
Code Description: Analyze how a particular sentence, chapter, scene, or stanza fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes to the development of the theme, setting, or plot.

Subject: Reading
Code Description: Explain how an author develops the point of view of the narrator or speaker in a text.

Subject: Reading
Code Description: Compare and contrast the experience of reading a story, drama, or poem to listening to or viewing an audio, video, or live version of the text, including contrasting what they “see” and “hear” when reading the text to what they perceive when they listen or watch.

Subject: Reading
Code Description: Compare and contrast texts in different forms or genres (e.g., stories and poems; historical novels and fantasy stories) in terms of their approaches to similar themes and topics.

Subject: Reading
Code Description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poems, in the grades 6–8 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

Subject: Reading
Code Description: RI

Subject: Reading
Code Description: Cite textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

Subject: Reading
Code Description: Determine a central idea of a text and how it is conveyed through particular details; provide a summary of the text distinct from personal opinions or judgments.

Subject: Reading
Code Description: Analyze in detail how a key individual, event, or idea is introduced, illustrated, and elaborated in a text (e.g., through examples or anecdotes).

Subject: Reading
Code Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings.

Subject: Reading
Code Description: Analyze how a particular sentence, paragraph, chapter, or section fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes to the development of the ideas.

Subject: Reading
Code Description: Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in a text and explain how it is conveyed in the text.

Subject: Reading
Code Description: Integrate information presented in different media or formats ((e.g., visually, quantitatively) as well as in words to develop a coherent understanding of a topic or issue.

Subject: Reading
Code Description: Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, distinguishing claims that are supported by reasons and evidence from claims that are not.

Subject: Reading
Code Description: Compare and contrast one author’s presentation of events with that of another (e.g., a memoir written by and a biography on the same person).

Subject: Reading
Code Description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literary nonfiction in the grades 6–8 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

Subject: Reading
Code Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 6 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies; Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word’s position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase; Use common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes ad roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., audience, auditory, audible); Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning or its part of speech; Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by checking the inferred meaning in context or in a dictionary).

Subject: Reading
Code Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings; Interpret figures of speech (e.g., personification) in context; Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., cause/effect, part/whole, item/category) to better understand each of the words; Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., stingy, scrimping, economical, unwasteful, thrifty).

Subject: Reading
Code Description: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases; gather vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

Subject: Writing
Code Description: L

Subject: Writing
Code Description: L.6.1. Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking; Ensure that pronouns are in the proper case (subjective, objective, possessive); Use intensive pronouns (e.g., myself, ourselves); Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in pronoun number and person; Recognize and correct vague pronouns (i.e., ones with unclear or ambiguous antecedents); Recognize variations from standard English in their own and others' writing and speaking, and identify and use strategies to improve expression in conventional language; Ensure that pronouns are in the proper case (subjective, objective, possessive).

Subject: Writing
Code Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing; Use punctuation (commas, parentheses, dashes) to set off nonrestrictive/parenthetical elements; Spell correctly.

Subject: Writing
Code Description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening; Vary sentence patterns for meaning, reader/listener interest, and style; Maintain consistency in style and tone

Subject: Writing
Code Description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence.

Subject: Writing
Code Description: Introduce claim(s) and organize the reasons and evidence clearly.

Subject: Writing
Code Description: Support claim(s) with clear reasons and relevant evidence, using credible sources and demonstrating an understanding of the topic or text.

Subject: Writing
Code Description: Use words, phrases, and clauses to clarify the relationships among claim(s) and reasons.

Subject: Writing
Code Description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

Subject: Writing
Code Description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from the argument presented.

Subject: Writing
Code Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content.

Subject: Writing
Code Description: Introduce a topic; organize ideas, concepts, and information, using strategies such as definition, classification, comparison/contrast, and cause/effect; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

Subject: Writing
Code Description: Develop the topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples.

Subject: Writing
Code Description: Use appropriate transitions to clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.

Subject: Writing
Code Description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

Subject: Writing
Code Description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

Subject: Writing
Code Description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from the information or explanation presented.

Subject: Writing
Code Description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience. (Grade-specific expectations for writing types are defined in standards 1–3 above.)

Subject: Writing
Code Description: With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.

Subject: Writing
Code Description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient command of keyboarding skills to type a minimum of three pages in a single sitting.

Subject: Writing
Code Description: Conduct short research projects to answer a question, drawing on several sources and refocusing the inquiry when appropriate.

Subject: Writing
Code Description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources; assess the credibility of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and providing basic bibliographic information for sources.

Subject: Writing
Code Description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

Subject: Writing
Code Description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

Subject: Social Studies
Code Description: Write arguments focused on discipline-specific content.

Subject: Social Studies
Code Description: Introduce claim(s) about a topic or issue, acknowledge and distinguish the claim(s) from alternate or opposing claims, and organize the reasons and evidence logically.

Subject: Social Studies
Code Description: Support claim(s) with logical reasoning and relevant, accurate data and evidence that demonstrate an understanding of the topic or text, using credible sources.

Subject: Social Studies
Code Description: Use words, phrases, and clauses to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among claim(s), counterclaims, reasons, and evidence.

Subject: Social Studies
Code Description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

Subject: Social Studies
Code Description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the argument presented.

Subject: Social Studies
Code Description: Write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events, scientific procedures/ experiments, or technical processes.

Subject: Social Studies
Code Description: Introduce a topic clearly, previewing what is to follow; organize ideas, concepts, and information into broader categories as appropriate to achieving purpose; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

Subject: Social Studies
Code Description: Develop the topic with relevant, well-chosen facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples.

Subject: Social Studies
Code Description: Use appropriate and varied transitions to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.

Subject: Social Studies
Code Description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

Subject: Social Studies
Code Description: Establish and maintain a formal style and objective tone.

Subject: Social Studies
Code Description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation presented.

Subject: Social Studies
Code Description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

Subject: Social Studies
Code Description: With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach, focusing on how well purpose and audience have been addressed.

Subject: Social Studies
Code Description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and present the relationships between information and ideas clearly and efficiently.

Subject: Social Studies
Code Description: Conduct short research projects to answer a question (including a self-generated question), drawing on several sources and generating additional related, focused questions that allow for multiple avenues of exploration.

Subject: Social Studies
Code Description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, using search terms effectively; assess the credibility and accuracy of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citation.

Subject: Social Studies
Code Description: Draw evidence from informational texts to support analysis reflection, and research.

Subject: Social Studies
Code Description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for reflection and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

Subject: Social Studies
Code Description: Cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of primary and secondary sources.

Subject: Social Studies
Code Description: Determine the central ideas or information of a primary or secondary source; provide an accurate summary of the source distinct from prior knowledge or opinions.

Subject: Social Studies
Code Description: Identify key steps in a text’s description of a process related to history/social studies (e.g., how a bill becomes law, how interest rates are raised or lowered).

Subject: Social Studies
Code Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including vocabulary specific to domains related to history/social studies.

Subject: Social Studies
Code Description: Describe how a text presents information (e.g., sequentially, comparatively, causally).

Subject: Social Studies
Code Description: Identify aspects of a text that reveal an author’s point of view or purpose (e.g., loaded language, inclusion or avoidance of particular facts).

Subject: Social Studies
Code Description: Integrate visual information (e.g., in charts, graphs, photographs, videos, or maps) with other information in print and digital texts.

Subject: Social Studies
Code Description: Distinguish among fact, opinion, and reasoned judgment in a text.

Subject: Social Studies
Code Description: Analyze the relationship between a primary and secondary source on the same topic.

Subject: Social Studies
Code Description: By the end of grade 8, read and comprehend history/social studies texts in the grades 6–8 text complexity band independently and proficiently.
